content:
(yoku yaru ne!) - Great effort on taking Japanese classes three times a week! Improving your conversation skills is a crucial part of language learning. Here are some popular language exchange apps that can help you practice your Japanese speaking skills:

1. **HelloTalk**: A highly-rated app that connects you with native Japanese speakers or language learners. You can text, voice or video call, and even correct each other's grammar and vocabulary.
2. **Tandem**: Similar to HelloTalk, Tandem allows you to practice your speaking skills with native speakers. It also offers a built-in translator and correction tools.
3. ** iTalki**: While not exclusively a language exchange app, iTalki connects you with language teachers and tutors for one-on-one lessons. You can find a Japanese language partner or tutor for conversation practice.
4. **Speaky**: A language exchange app that offers text, voice, and video chat with native speakers. It also has a built-in language learning platform with exercises and quizzes.
5. **Lingbe**: A unique app that focuses on live voice and video calls with native speakers. You can practice your speaking skills in real-time and get feedback on your pronunciation.
6. **Conversation Exchange**: A website and app that connects you with language learners and native speakers for language exchange. You can search for Japanese language exchange partners and practice your speaking skills via text, voice, or video chat.
7. **Lang-8**: A language learning and exchange platform where you can write journal entries in Japanese and receive corrections from native speakers. You can also practice your speaking skills with language exchange partners.
8. **Discord**: While not a traditional language exchange app, Discord is a popular platform for language learners and native speakers to connect and practice their speaking skills in voice or video chat.

Remember to always be respectful and considerate of your language exchange partners' time and language level. Good luck, and (ganbare) - do your best!

Which app do you think you might try first?
